flattened_csv.Definition: Unique row ID within the dataset. Calculated depending on the unit of observation with the use of tender-lot-bid unique pairs
flattened_csv.Notes: This should be either a generated ID, or source id if there is one

flattened_csv.Definition: Unique ID of the tender within the dataset.
flattened_csv.Notes: This should be either a generated ID, or source id if there is one

flattened_csv.Definition: Stable generated ID unique for tender.
Criteria used to decide the winning bid, often based on price, quality, or both.
flattened_csv.Notes: Text field which could be further analyzed using text analysis methods

flattened_csv.Definition: Latest date by which the tender must be awarded.
Date when the decision on who wins the tender was made.
Final date for submitting bids (or requests to participate in restricted/negotiated procedures).
Date when the tender was cancelled or when the cancellation was officially published.
Official reason given for cancelling the tender.
flattened_csv.Notes: Text field which could be further analyzed using text analysis methods

flattened_csv.Definition: Date when the contract with the winning bidder was signed.
Were there modifications made to the tender after publication.
flattened_csv.Notes: Depends on whether there is meta-data avilable or old versions of calls
flattened_csv.Indicator type / filter: filter (unless n of modifications is available)

flattened_csv.Definition: Country where the tender is issued, in ISO 3166 format (e.g., "DE" for Germany).
Common Procurement Vocabulary (CPV) codes describing the goods, services, or works being procured.
Main Common Procurement Vocabulary (CPV) code describing the goods, services, or works being procured.
Description of what the tender is for.
Finullcial conditions the bidder must meet.
flattened_csv.Notes: Text field which could be further analyzed using text analysis methods

flattened_csv.Definition: Qualifications or requirements a bidder must meet to be eligible.
flattened_csv.Notes: Text field which could be further analyzed using text analysis methods

flattened_csv.Definition: Expected end date of the contract’s execution.
Estimated total value of the tender.
Currency of the estimated total value of the tender.
flattened_csv.Notes: depends if currency is available at source

flattened_csv.Definition: Expected start date of the tender or contract.
Whether the tender has been awarded to a bidder.
Whether the tender is run by a central purchasing authority.
flattened_csv.Notes: Depends on whether the source is mentioned in the data or needs to be manually added

flattened_csv.Definition: Whether the tender is covered by the WTI framework agreement. See more: https://www.wto.org/english/tratop_e/gproc_e/gp_gpa_e.htm
flattened_csv.Notes: Most likely to be added manually based on the country status

flattened_csv.Definition: Whether the tender starts a Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) or purchases via an existing DPS.
Whether electronic invoicing will be accepted.
Whether the winner was chosen via an electronic auction.
Whether the tender is for a framework agreement (main or subsidiary).
Whether multiple buyers jointly conduct the procurement.
Whether the purchase is made on behalf of another organization.
Reason for modifying the tender.
Type of national procurement procedure, as originally published (unstructured text).
Organizations for which the purchase is made.
flattened_csv.Notes: Should have identifiers for buyer bode

flattened_csv.Definition: Requirements related to the bidder’s personnel (e.g., qualifications, experience).
Standardized type of procurement procedure.
flattened_csv.Notes: Check enumeration

flattened_csv.Definition: Tender announcement link.
Method used to select the winner (lowest price or MEAT).
flattened_csv.Notes: Should be enumerated and generated at the processing step

flattened_csv.Definition: Goods, services, or works being procured.
Technical specifications bidders must meet.
flattened_csv.Notes: Text field which could be further analyzed using text analysis methods

flattened_csv.Definition: Year of the tender, calculated from the earliest available relevant date (e.g., award notice date, contract signature date).
flattened_csv.Notes: Could be calculated manually from other dates

flattened_csv.Definition: Official title of the tender.
Final value of the tender.
Currency of the final value of the tender.
flattened_csv.Notes: depends if currency is available at source

flattened_csv.Definition: Address of the tender's implementation
Number of contract award publications related to a given tender.
flattened_csv.Notes: depends if the data is available at source

flattened_csv.Definition: Number of call for tenders (or contract notice) publications related to a given tender.
flattened_csv.Notes: depends if the data is available at source

flattened_csv.Definition: Source of the tender.
Unique ID of the lot within the dataset.
flattened_csv.Notes: This should be either a generated ID, or source id if there is one

flattened_csv.Definition: Sequential identifier for each lot within a tender.
Title or label of the lot.
Indicates the status of the lot as shows on the source
Indicates the status of the lot (awarded, cancelled, etc)
flattened_csv.Notes: Check enumeration

flattened_csv.Definition: Number of bids submitted for the lot.
Number of valid (non-excluded) bids submitted.
Number of bids submitted electronically.
Number of bids submitted by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).
Number of bids submitted by foreign companies.
Most recent expected completion date for the lot.
Most recent contract duration (in days) for the lot.
Estimated value of the lot.
Currency of the estimated lot value.
Text description of the lot.
Unique identified of the bid within dataset
flattened_csv.Notes: This should be either a generated ID, or source id if there is one

flattened_csv.Definition: Final bid price offered.
Currency of the bid price.
Original (initial) bid price submitted.
Currency of the original bid price.
Indicator showing if the bid was the winning one.
Indicator showing if subcontracting is planned.
Proportion (%) of the contract expected to be subcontracted.
Indicator showing if the bid was submitted by a consortium.
Primary identifier of the bidder company unique for the dataset.
Type of supplier's ID (eg. Tax, bvd, national register, etc)
flattened_csv.Notes: Depends on whether this data is available at the source

flattened_csv.Definition: Standardized identifier assigned during processing (based on name, source IDs, address).
Official name of the bidder company.
NUTS or other regional codes of the bidder.
flattened_csv.Notes: for EU countries; sometimes NUTS could be derived from postal codes if needed

flattened_csv.Definition: City where the bidder company is located.
Postal code of the bidder company.
Country where the bidder company is located.
Contact email address of the bidder company.
Raw address of the bidder company.
Unique identifier of the buyer as published in the source data.
flattened_csv.Notes: This should be either a generated ID, or source id if there is one

flattened_csv.Definition: Standardized identifier assigned during processing (based on name, source ID, address).
Official name of the buyer organization.
NUTS or other regional codes of the buyer (from source publication).
flattened_csv.Notes: for EU countries; sometimes NUTS could be derived from postal codes if needed

flattened_csv.Definition: Contact email address of the buyer.
Name of the contact person at the buyer organization.
General contact point for the buyer (e.g., department, office).
City where the buyer is located.
Country where the buyer is located.
Type of buyer as it appears on the source
Type of buyer (e.g., national, regional, etc)
flattened_csv.Notes: Check enumeration

flattened_csv.Definition: Postal code of the buyer’s location.
Raw address of the buyer's location.
Unique ID of the item within the dataset.
flattened_csv.Notes: This should be either a generated ID, or source id if there is one

flattened_csv.Definition: Sequential identifier for each item within a tender-lot.
EUR, USD
Net price per unit, expressed in national currency.
Number of units.
Type of unit used for pricing as appears on the source.
Type of unit used for pricing (e.g., EUR/KG, EUR/L).
flattened_csv.Notes: Check enumeration

flattened_csv.Definition: Description of the item as published.
Unique identifier of the modification or amendment record.
Text  description explaining why the modification was made (e.g., price adjustment, extension of duration, technical change, correction of error)
Date when the modification was formally issued, signed, or published, depending on the data source
Monetary value of the contribution provided by the funding source, expressed in the tender or contract currency.
Name or classification of the funding program under which the procurement is finullced (e.g., Operational Programme, EU Structural Fund, national co-finullcing scheme, etc).
Share or percentage of the total contract or project value finullced by this funding source.
Name or identifier of the organization or body providing the funds (e.g., European Commission, national ministry, international donor).

enumeration.Description: Lot is being prepared but not yet published or announced.
Lot is publicly announced and open for bids or negotiations.
Lot or procedure was cancelled before contract award.
Lot received no valid bids or award decision was not made.
Lot has been awarded to one or more suppliers.
Preliminary award decision or notice of intended award (e.g. in framework agreements).
Contract(s) for the lot were executed and fully completed/paid.
Construction or civil engineering works.
Supply of goods, materials, or products.
Provision of services.
Type of supply not falling into the main three categories.
Open procedure where any supplier may submit a bid.
Restricted procedure with pre-qualification of bidders.
Negotiated procedure with prior publication of a contract notice.
Negotiated procedure without prior publication (direct award under exceptions).
Competitive dialogue procedure with discussions before final bids.
Procedure for development and purchase of innovative works, supplies or services.
Procedure for design proposals, often used for architecture or planning.
Call-off under a dynamic purchasing system.
Call-off or mini-tender under a framework agreement.
Direct contract award to one supplier.
Award of a concession contract where operator bears operational risk.
National-level open contest procedure (non-EU).
Generic negotiated procedure (national).
Sealed-bid or invited competition (non-EU).
International Competitive Bidding (World Bank).
National Competitive Bidding (World Bank).
Direct Contracting (World Bank).
Procedure not classified under known categories.
Central government authority (e.g., ministry, department).
Central government implementation or executive agency.
Subnational government authority (region, province, state).
Regional or local implementation agency.
Publicly controlled entity not part of central/regional administration.
Utility operator in water, energy, transport, or postal services.
European-level institution or agency.
Other or undefined type of contracting authority.
Metre (length).
Kilometre (length).
Square metre (area).
Hectare (area).
Litre (volume).
Millilitre (volume).
Cubic metre (volume).
Gram (mass).
Kilogram (mass).
Tonne (metric ton).
Hour (time).
Day (time).
Month (time).
Year (time).
Minute (time).
Second (time).
Piece / unit (count).
Ration / package.
Other or unspecified unit of measure.

enumeration.Categories: ISO country codes (e.g., AT, DE, FR, IT, etc.)
enumeration.Description: Two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of bidder or buyer.
Kosovo (user-assigned ISO code, widely used).
Unknown or not declared country.
European Union (regional code; optional derived category).
National taxpayer identification number (TIN, VAT number, or fiscal code used for taxation).
Official organization identifier from a national register (e.g., company number, legal entity register code).
Identifier issued by a commercial or trade register authority (e.g., Chamber of Commerce registration number).
Bureau van Dijk ORBIS/AMADEUS unique identifier for legal entities, used in business databases.
Legal Entity Identifier (ISO 17442-compliant global ID, 20-character alphanumeric).
Other or unspecified type of organization identifier not covered above.
Identifier type not provided or unclear in the data source.
